definitions: Struck or beaten with a whip or similar instrument.
Moved or removed with a sudden, quick motion.
Beat (cream, eggs, etc.) rapidly to incorporate air and produce a frothy consistency.
Achieved a victory over (an opponent) in a contest or game.
examples: The jockey whipped the horse to encourage it to run faster.
She whipped out her phone to take a picture.
He whipped the cream until it was stiff.
Our team whipped the competition in the final round.
